paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a variant in the KCNH2 gene associated with a patient presenting with bidirectional ventricular tachycardia.

patients.phenotype: bidirectional ventricular tachycardia, long QTU phenotype

individual_records.phenotype_details: recurrent syncope during exercise, bidirectional ventricular tachycardia
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient harbors a variation in KCNH2 gene that encodes the potassium voltage-gated channel subfamily H member 2 protein.
the patient’s father harbored the same variation in the KCNH2 gene.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with long QT syndrome and may contribute to the expressed phenotype.

variants.segregation_data: The KCNH2 variant segregates with the disease in the proband and his father.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on family segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was classified as a variant of unclear significance (VUS).
key_quotes: The identified variant in the present patient has been previously reported in a proband and his mother with LQTS2.
The association between HCM and QTc prolongation has been reported with prolongation of repolarization attributed to the sheer mass of ventricular myocardium.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was extracted from the main text.
